message: Is it professional for a recruiter to not give me a reply 15 days after an interview and ignore my inquiry message?

data.message: لا و بعتبرها قلة ذوق منهم فعلاً و حركة غير محترفة بالمرة و كويس انك متشتغلش مع ناس زي دي ايا كان اسمهم او حجم اعمالهم.

He got millions of messages from rejected candidates , he can't reply to all of them saying that they r rejected cause logically they will ask for the reason , so do u think that he have time to explain for everyone , of course not 
Note : I'm not Hr but I was in a situation same like that and here is my answer , hope it helps 
Good luck
الاماكن المحترمة هي اللي تبعت rejection email و فيه السبب..  فعلا انا مرة جالي من شركة كدا احترمتهم جداجدا
we are high context culture where relations and personal impression highly influence the hiring decision. it should be business is business as it is more clear and efficient.
I don't like the fact of sending "rejection" email. It is a negative message. If the candidate asked, then he must be answered.
Yes it is normal. It depends on the recruiter. Don't take it personal. However, It is your responsibility to follow up on your application.
